00010 #include "jcom.parameter.h"             // everything we need is in here
00011 
00012 // Globals
00013 t_class         *parameter_class;               // Required: Global pointer for our class
00014 t_class         *message_class;
00015 
00016 bool            g_pattr_valid;          // Did pattr init successfully?
00017         
00018 int param_list_compare(t_atom *x, long lengthx, t_atom *y, long lengthy);
00019 
00020 /************************************************************************************/
00021 // Class Definition
00022 
00023 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00024 {
00025         t_class         *c;
00026         t_object        *attr = NULL;
00027         long            offset;
00028         
00029         // Initialize Globals
00030         g_pattr_valid = false;
00031         jamoma_init();
00032 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00033         // TODO: move this into the framework [TAP]
00034         short           err = 0;
00035         err = ext_pattr_setup();
00036         if(err){
00037                 //post("Jamoma: pattr integration is not available - could not init pattr-bundle");
00038                 g_pattr_valid = false;
00039         }
00040         else
00041                 g_pattr_valid = true;
00042 #endif
00043 
00044         // Define our class
00045         c = class_new(OBJECT_CLASS_NAME,(method)param_new, (method)param_free, 
00046                 (short)sizeof(t_param), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00047         offset = calcoffset(t_param, common);
00048         class_obexoffset_set(c, offset + calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_common, obex));
00049 
00050         if(g_pattr_valid == true)
00051                 pattr_obex_init(c);                     // set up the pattr obex
00052                 
00053         // Make methods accessible for our class:
00054         // Note that we can't make the bang method directly accessible here (must go through another function)
00055         //      because the function pointer is in out struct, which hasn't been defined yet
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dispatched,                            "dispatched",                                   A_GIMME,        0);
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_int,                                           "int",                                                  A_DEFLONG,      0);
00058         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_float,                                         "float",                                                A_DEFFLOAT,     0);
00059         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_list,                                          "list",                                                 A_GIMME,        0);
00060         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_symbol,                                        "anything",                                             A_GIMME,        0);
00061         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_setRampFunctionParameter,      "ramp/function/parameter",              A_GIMME,        0);
00062         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_getRampFunctionParameter,      "ramp/function/parameter/get",  A_GIMME,        0);
00063         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_setRampDriveParameter,         "ramp/drive/parameter",                 A_GIMME,        0);
00064         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_getRampDriveParameter,         "ramp/drive/parameter/get",             A_GIMME,        0);
00065         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_ui_refresh,                            "ui/refresh",                                   0);
00066         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_inc,                                           "inc",                                                  A_GIMME,        0);
00067         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dec,                                           "dec",                                                  A_GIMME,        0);
00068         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_inc,                                           "+",                                                    A_GIMME,        0);
00069         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dec,                                           "-",                                                    A_GIMME,        0);
00070         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_dump,                                          "dump",                                                 0);
00071         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_bang,                                          "bang",                                                 0);
00072         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_rampUpdate,                            "ramp/update",                                  0);
00073         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_assist,                                        "assist",                                               A_CANT,         0); 
00074 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00075         class_addmethod(c, (method)param_reset,                                         "reset",                                                0);
00076         if(g_pattr_valid == true){
00077                 // required to manually add because of our pattr-wrapping for parameters
00078                 class_addmethod(c, (method)param_getvalueof,                    "getvalueof",   A_CANT, 0);
00079                 class_addmethod(c, (method)param_setvalueof,                    "setvalueof",   A_CANT, 0);
00080                 class_addmethod(c, (method)pattr_obex_notify,                   "notify",               A_CANT, 0);     
00081         }
00082 #endif
00083 
00084         if(g_pattr_valid == true)
00085                 jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_extended(c, attr, offset, false);        // don't define name attr
00086         else
00087                 jcom_core_subscriber_classinit_extended(c, attr, offset, true);         // define a name attr
00088                 
00089         // ATTRIBUTE: ramp      
00090         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "ramp/drive", _sym_symbol,
00091                 (method)param_attr_setramp, (method)param_attr_getramp,
00092                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_ramp));
00093         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "ramp/function", _sym_symbol,
00094                 (method)param_attr_setrampfunction, (method)param_attr_getrampfunction,
00095                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_rampfunction));
00096 
00097         // ATTRIBUTE: type - options are msg_generic, msg_int, msg_float, msg_symbol, msg_toggle, msg_list, msg_none
00098         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "type", _sym_symbol,
00099                 (method)param_attr_settype, (method)param_attr_gettype,
00100                 calcoffset(t_jcom_core_subscriber_extended, attr_type));
00101         
00102         // ATTRIBUTE: ui/freeze - toggles a "frozen" ui outlet so that you can save cpu
00103         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "ui/freeze", _sym_long,
00104                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getfreeze,
00105                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_ui_freeze));
00106         
00107         // ATTRIBUTE: slavemode - indicates that the instance is slave to another parameter/message
00108         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "slave", _sym_long,
00109                 (method)0, (method)0,
00110                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_slavemode));
00111 
00112         // ATTRIBUTE: stepsize - how much increment or decrement by
00113         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "stepsize", _sym_float32,
00114                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getstepsize,
00115                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_stepsize));
00116 
00117         // ATTRIBUTE: priority - used to determine order of parameter recall in a preset
00118         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "priority", _sym_long,
00119                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getpriority,
00120                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_priority));
00121 
00122         // ATTRIBUTE: value
00123         jamoma_class_attr_array_new(c, "value", _sym_atom, LISTSIZE,
00124                 (method)0, (method)param_attr_getvalue,
00125                 calcoffset(t_param, list_size), calcoffset(t_param, attr_value));
00126 
00127         // ATTRIBUTE: value/default
00128         jamoma_class_attr_array_new(c, "default", _sym_atom, LISTSIZE,
00129                 (method)0, (method)0,
00130                 calcoffset(t_param, listDefault_size), calcoffset(t_param, attr_valueDefault));
00131 
00132         // ATTRIBUTE:
00133         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "dataspace", _sym_symbol,
00134                 (method)0, (method)0,
00135                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_dataspace));
00136         
00137         // ATTRIBUTE:
00138         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "unit/active", _sym_symbol,
00139                 (method)0, (method)0,
00140                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_unitActive));
00141 
00142         // ATTRIBUTE:
00143         jamoma_class_attr_new(c, "unit/native", _sym_symbol,
00144                 (method)0, (method)0,
00145                 calcoffset(t_param, attr_unitNative));
00146 
00147         // Finalize our class
00148         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00149 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00150         message_class = c;
00151 #else
00152         parameter_class = c;
00153 #endif
00154         return 0;
00155 }
00156 
00157 
00158 /************************************************************************************/
00159 // Object Life
00160 #pragma mark -
00161 #pragma mark life cycle
00162 
00163 void *param_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00164 {
00165         short           i;
00166         long            attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);
00167 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00168         t_param         *x = (t_param *)object_alloc(message_class);
00169 #else
00170         t_param         *x = (t_param *)object_alloc(parameter_class);
00171 #endif
00172         t_symbol        *name = _sym_nothing;
00173 
00174         if(attrstart && argv)
00175                 atom_arg_getsym(&name, 0, attrstart, argv);
00176         else
00177                 name = symbol_unique();
00178 
00179         if(x){
00180                 for(i=num_outlets; i > 0; i--)
00181                         x->outlets[i-1] = outlet_new(x, 0);
00182                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (t_object *)x->outlets[k_outlet_dumpout]);
00183                 
00184                 x->ui_qelem = qelem_new(x, (method)param_ui_queuefn);
00185                 x->ramp_qelem = qelem_new(x, (method)param_ramp_setup);
00186 
00187                 // set defaults...
00188                 x->attr_rampfunction = _sym_nothing;
00189                 x->attr_ramp = _sym_nothing;
00190                 x->ramper = NULL;
00191 
00192                 // defaulted to one long above, set list to be of size 1
00193                 x->list_size = 1;
00194                 x->listDefault_size = 0;
00195                 for(i = 0; i < LISTSIZE; i++){
00196                         atom_setlong(&x->atom_list[i], 0);
00197                         atom_setlong(&x->atom_listDefault[i], 0);
00198                 }
00199                 x->name = name;
00200                 atom_setsym(&x->name_atom, name);
00201                 x->attr_ui_freeze = 0;
00202                 x->attr_slavemode = 0;
00203                 x->attr_stepsize = 1.0;
00204                 x->attr_priority = 0;                                           // default is no priority
00205                 x->param_output = &param_output_generic;                // set function pointer to default
00206                 x->attr_dataspace = ps_none;
00207                 x->attr_unitActive = ps_none;
00208                 x->attr_unitNative = ps_none;
00209                 
00210 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00211                 jcom_core_subscriber_new_extended(&x->common, name, ps_subscribe_message);
00212 #else
00213                 jcom_core_subscriber_new_extended(&x->common, name, ps_subscribe_parameter);
00214 #endif
00215                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                       // handle attribute args
00216                 if(g_pattr_valid == true)
00217                         pattr_obex_setup(x, name);                              // set up out internal pattr instance
00218 
00219 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00220                 param_reset(x); 
00221 #endif
00222                 defer_low(x, (method)jcom_core_subscriber_subscribe, 0, 0, 0);
00223                 
00224                 // If no type was specified by the user we call the accessor here
00225                 // this is important because memory is configured - not just setting a default!
00226                 if(x->common.attr_type == NULL){
00227                         t_atom a;
00228                         atom_setsym(&a, ps_msg_generic);
00229                         object_attr_setvalueof(x, ps_type, 1, &a);
00230                 }
00231                 if(x->attr_ramp == _sym_nothing){
00232                         t_atom a;
00233                         atom_setsym(&a, ps_none);
00234                         object_attr_setvalueof(x, gensym("ramp/drive"), 1, &a);
00235                 }
00236         }
00237         return (x);                                                                             // return the pointer to our new instantiation
00238 }
00239 
00240 
00241 void param_free(t_param *x)
00242 {       
00243         jcom_core_subscriber_common_free((t_jcom_core_subscriber_common *)x);
00244         qelem_free(x->ui_qelem);
00245         qelem_free(x->ramp_qelem);
00246         if(x->ramper)
00247                 delete x->ramper;
00248 }

00250 
00251 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00252 /************************************************************************************/
00253 // Communication with PSTO (pattrstorage)
00254 #pragma mark -
00255 #pragma mark pattr support
00256 
00257 // FROM psto
00258 t_max_err param_setvalueof(t_param *x, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00259 {
00260         if(argc && argv) {
00261                 sysmem_copyptr(argv, &x->atom_list[0], sizeof(t_atom) * argc);
00262                 x->list_size = argc;
00263                 x->param_output(x);
00264         }       
00265         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00266 }
00267 
00268 // TO psto
00269 t_max_err param_getvalueof(t_param *x, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00270 {
00271         if(argc && argv){
00272                 if(*argc && *argv) {
00273                         // use passed in memory
00274                 } 
00275                 else { 
00276                         if(x->list_size > 1)
00277                                 *argv = (t_atom *)getbytes(sizeof(t_atom) * x->list_size);
00278                         else
00279                                 *argv = (t_atom *)getbytes(sizeof(t_atom));
00280                 }
00281                 
00282                 *argc = x->list_size > 1 ? x->list_size : 1;
00283                 sysmem_copyptr(&x->atom_list[0], *argv, sizeof(t_atom) * (*argc));
00284         }
00285         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00286 }
00287 
00288 #endif
00289 
00290 
00291 /************************************************************************************/
00292 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00293 #pragma mark -
00294 #pragma mark attribute accessors
00295 
00296 
00297 // resets to default value
00298 void param_reset(t_param *x)
00299 {
00300         if(x->listDefault_size){                                                // copy the default values to the current value
00301                 sysmem_copyptr(x->atom_listDefault, x->atom_list, sizeof(t_atom) * x->listDefault_size);
00302                 x->list_size = x->listDefault_size;
00303         }
00304 }
00305 
00306 
00307 // ATTRIBUTE: TYPE
00308 // This is crucial because it sets function pointers for the optimized clipping, bang, and other functions
00309 t_max_err param_attr_settype(t_param *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00310 {
00311         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00312         x->common.attr_type = arg;
00313 
00314         if(arg == ps_msg_int){
00315                 x->param_output = &param_output_int;
00316         }
00317         else if(arg == ps_msg_float){
00318                 x->param_output = &param_output_float;
00319         }
00320         else if(arg == ps_msg_symbol){
00321                 x->param_output = &param_output_symbol;
00322         }
00323         else if(arg == ps_msg_toggle){
00324                 x->param_output = &param_output_int;
00325         }
00326         else if(arg == ps_msg_generic){
00327                 x->param_output = &param_output_generic;
00328         } 
00329         else if(arg == ps_msg_list){
00330                 x->param_output = &param_output_list;
00331         }
00332 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00333         else if(arg == ps_msg_none){
00334                 x->param_output = &param_output_none;
00335         }
00336 #endif // JMOD_MESSAGE
00337         else{
00338 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00339                 error("Jamoma - invalid type specified for %s jcom.message in the %s module.", x->name->s_name, x->common.module_name->s_name);
00340 #else
00341                 error("Jamoma - invalid type specified for %s jcom.parameter in the %s module.", x->name->s_name, x->common.module_name->s_name);
00342 #endif
00343                 x->common.attr_type = ps_msg_generic;
00344                 x->param_output = &param_output_generic;
00345         }
00346 
00347         qelem_set(x->ramp_qelem);       // set up the rampunit with callbacks appropriate to this data type
00348 
00349         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00350         #pragma unused(attr)
00351 }
00352 
00353 
00354 // ATTRIBUTE: RAMP
00355 // This is crucial because it sets function pointers
00356 t_max_err param_attr_setramp(t_param *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00357 {
00358         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00359         x->attr_ramp = arg;
00360         
00361         qelem_set(x->ramp_qelem);       // place a call to param_ramp_setup() at the end of the low-priority queue
00362 
00363         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00364         #pragma unused(attr)
00365 }
00366 
00367 t_max_err param_attr_getramp(t_param *x, void *attr, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00368 {
00369         *argc = 1;
00370         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00371                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom));
00372         atom_setsym(*argv, x->attr_ramp);
00373         
00374 //      jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);
00375         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00376 }
00377 
00378 
00379 t_max_err param_attr_setrampfunction(t_param *x, void *attr, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00380 {
00381         t_symbol *arg = atom_getsym(argv);
00382         x->attr_rampfunction = arg;
00383 
00384         if(x->ramper)
00385                 x->ramper->setFunction(x->attr_rampfunction);
00386 
00387         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00388         #pragma unused(attr)
00389 }
00390 
00391 t_max_err param_attr_getrampfunction(t_param *x, void *attr, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00392 {
00393         *argc = 1;
00394         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00395                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom));
00396         atom_setsym(*argv, x->attr_rampfunction);
00397 
00398 //      jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);
00399         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00400 }

00409 
00410 //      jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);

00412 }

00414

00416 {
00417         *argc = 1;
00418         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00419                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom));
00420         atom_setlong(*argv, x->attr_ui_freeze);
00421

00439 t_max_err param_attr_getpriority(t_param *x, void *attr, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00440 {
00441         *argc = 1;
00442         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00443                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom));

00449 
00450 
00451 t_max_err param_attr_getvalue(t_param *x, void *attr, long *argc, t_atom **argv)
00452 {
00453         *argc = x->list_size;
00454         if (!(*argv)) // otherwise use memory passed in
00455                 *argv = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom) * x->list_size);
00456         sysmem_copyptr(x->atom_list, *argv, sizeof(t_atom) * x->list_size);
00457 
00458 //      jamoma_class_attr_get_sender((t_object*)x, attr, *argc, *argv);
00459         return MAX_ERR_NONE;
00460 }
00461 
00462 
00463 void param_getRampFunctionParameter(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00464 {
00465         t_symbol        *parameterName;
00466         t_atom          *a;
00467         long            ac = 0;
00468         t_atom          *av = NULL;
00469         
00470         if(!argc){
00471                 error("jcom.map: not enough arguments to getParameter");
00472                 return;
00473         }
00474         
00475         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv);
00476         //x->function->getParameter(parameterName, &ac, &av);
00477         x->ramper->getFunctionParameter(parameterName, &ac, &av);
00478         if(ac) {
00479                 //atom_setsym(a+0, parameterName);
00480                 //atom_setfloat(a+1, av);
00481                 a = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom)*(ac+1));
00482                 // Forst list item is name of parameter
00483                 atom_setsym(a, parameterName);
00484                 // Next the whole shebang is copied
00485                 sysmem_copyptr(av, a+1, sizeof(t_atom)*ac);
00486                 object_obex_dumpout(x, gensym("ramp.function.getParameter"), ac+1, av);
00487         
00488                 // The pointer to an atom assign in the getParameter method needs to be freed.
00489                 sysmem_freeptr(av);
00490                 sysmem_freeptr(a);
00491         }
00492 }
00493 
00494 
00495 void param_setRampFunctionParameter(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00496 {
00497         //double                value = 0.0;
00498         t_symbol        *parameterName;
00499         
00500         if(argc < 2){
00501                 error("jcom.map: not enough arguments to setParameter");
00502                 return;
00503         }
00504         
00505         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv);
00506         //x->function->setParameter(parameterName, argc-1, argv+1);
00507         x->ramper->setFunctionParameter(parameterName, argc-1, argv+1);
00508 }
00509 
00510 
00511 void param_getRampDriveParameter(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00512 {
00513         short err = 0;
00514         
00515         t_symbol        *parameterName;
00516         t_atom          *a;
00517         long            ac = 0;
00518         t_atom  *av = NULL;
00519 
00520         
00521         if(!argc != 1){
00522                 error("jcom.ramp::attrset -- bad arguments");
00523                 return;
00524         }
00525         
00526         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv);
00527         err = x->ramper->attrget(parameterName, ac, av);
00528         
00529         if(!err && ac) {
00530                 // Assign memory so that attr values can be copied
00531                 a = (t_atom *)sysmem_newptr(sizeof(t_atom)*(ac+1));
00532                 // First list item is name of parameter
00533                 atom_setsym(a, parameterName);
00534                 // Next the whole shebang is copied
00535                 sysmem_copyptr(a+1, av, sizeof(t_atom)*ac);
00536                 object_obex_dumpout(x, gensym("current.parameter"), ac+1, a);
00537         
00538                 // The pointer to an atom assign in the getParameter method needs to be freed.
00539                 sysmem_freeptr(av);
00540                 sysmem_freeptr(a);
00541         }
00542 }
00543 
00544 
00545 void param_setRampDriveParameter(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00546 {
00547         //double                value = 0.0;
00548         t_symbol        *parameterName;
00549         
00550         if(argc < 2){
00551                 error("jcom.map: not enough arguments to setParameter");
00552                 return;
00553         }
00554         
00555         parameterName = atom_getsym(argv);
00556         //value = atom_getfloat(argv+1);
00557         x->ramper->attrset(parameterName, argc-1, argv+1);
00558 }
00559 
00560 
00561 /************************************************************************************/
00562 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00563 #pragma mark -
00564 #pragma mark methods
00565 
00566 // Method for Assistance Messages
00567 void param_assist(t_param *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00568 {
00569         if(msg==1)                                              // Inlet
00570                 strcpy(dst, "input");
00571         else{                                                   // Outlets
00572                 switch(arg){
00573                         case k_outlet_set:
00574                                         strcpy(dst, "set: connect to ui object");
00575                                         break;
00576                         case k_outlet_direct:
00577                                         strcpy(dst, "direct: values");
00578                                         break;
00579                         case k_outlet_dumpout:
00580                                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout");
00581                                         break;
00582                 }
00583         }               
00584 }
00585 
00586 
00587 // DUMP: use for debugging - dump state to the Max window
00588 void param_dump(t_param *x)
00589 {
00590         char    s[256];
00591         t_atom  a[4];
00592         
00593         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00594                 sprintf(s, "%s:clipmode", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00595                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00596                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->common.attr_clipmode);
00597                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00598 
00599                 sprintf(s, "%s:description", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00600                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00601                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->common.attr_description);
00602                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00603 
00604                 sprintf(s, "%s:priority", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00605                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00606                 atom_setlong(&a[1], x->attr_priority);
00607                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00608 
00609                 sprintf(s, "%s:ramp", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00610                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00611                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->attr_ramp);
00612                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00613 
00614                 sprintf(s, "%s:range", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00615                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00616                 atom_setfloat(&a[1], x->common.attr_range[0]);
00617                 atom_setfloat(&a[2], x->common.attr_range[1]);
00618                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 3, a, NULL);
00619 
00620                 sprintf(s, "%s:repetitions", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00621                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00622                 atom_setlong(&a[1], x->common.attr_repetitions);
00623                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00624 
00625                 sprintf(s, "%s:type", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00626                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00627                 atom_setsym(&a[1], x->common.attr_type);
00628                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00629 
00630                 sprintf(s, "%s:ui/freeze", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00631                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00632                 atom_setlong(&a[1], x->attr_ui_freeze);
00633                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00634 
00635                 sprintf(s, "%s:value", x->common.attr_name->s_name);
00636                 atom_setsym(&a[0], gensym(s));
00637                 jcom_core_atom_copy(&a[1], &x->attr_value);
00638                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 2, a, NULL);
00639         }
00640 }
00641 
00642 
00643 // 'bang' method for user input
00644 void param_bang(t_param *x)
00645 {
00646 #ifdef JMOD_MESSAGE
00647         t_atom  a;
00648         
00649         atom_setsym(&a, gensym(""));
00650         outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_long);
00651         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_set], _sym_set, 1, &a);
00652 
00653         // call on the hub to pass our data onward
00654         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00655                 jcom_core_atom_copy(&a, &x->name_atom);
00656                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 1, &a, NULL);
00657         }
00658 #else
00659         x->param_output(x);
00660 #endif
00661 }
00662 
00663 
00664 // Actual bang functions
00665 void param_output_generic(void *z)
00666 {
00667         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00668         
00669         if(x->list_size == 1){
00670                 param_clip_generic(x);
00671                 if(x->attr_value.a_type == A_LONG)
00672                         outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_long);
00673                 else if(x->attr_value.a_type == A_FLOAT)
00674                         outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_float);
00675                 else if(x->attr_value.a_type == A_SYM)
00676                         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_sym, 0, NULL);
00677         }
00678         else if(x->list_size > 1){
00679                 param_clip_generic(x);
00680                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, x->list_size, x->atom_list);
00681         } 
00682         else{   // zero args
00683                 param_output_none(x);
00684         }
00685         param_send_feedback(x);
00686 }
00687 
00688 
00689 void param_output_int(void *z)
00690 {
00691         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00692 
00693         param_clip_int(x);
00694         outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_long);
00695         param_send_feedback(x);
00696 }
00697 
00698 
00699 void param_output_float(void *z)
00700 {
00701         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00702 
00703         param_clip_float(x);
00704         outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_float);
00705         param_send_feedback(x);
00706 }
00707 
00708 
00709 void param_output_symbol(void *z)
00710 {
00711         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00712 
00713         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], x->attr_value.a_w.w_sym, 0, NULL);
00714         param_send_feedback(x);
00715 }
00716 
00717 
00718 void param_output_list(void *z)
00719 {
00720         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00721         
00722         param_clip_list(x);
00723         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, x->list_size, x->atom_list);
00724         param_send_feedback(x);
00725 }
00726 
00727 
00728 void param_output_none(void *z)
00729 {
00730         t_param *x = (t_param *)z;
00731         t_atom output[1];
00732         t_atom *out = (t_atom *)(&output);
00733 
00734         // bang direct output
00735         outlet_bang(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct]);
00736         
00737         // call on the hub to pass our data onward
00738         // We can not use (method)param_send_feedback here as it assumes an additional argument
00739         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00740                 jcom_core_atom_copy(out, &x->name_atom);
00741                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, 1, out, NULL);
00742         }
00743 }
00744 
00745 
00746 // INC & DEC
00747 void param_inc(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00748 {
00749         float   stepmult = 1.0;
00750         long    ramptime = 0;           // ms
00751         t_atom  a[3];                           // value, 'ramp', value
00752         short   a_len = 1;
00753         
00754         // Check for slave mode
00755         if(x->attr_slavemode) {
00756                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], ps_inc, 0, NULL);
00757                 return;
00758         }
00759         
00760         // Check for Arguments...
00761         if(argc){
00762                 // Look for arg to specify the number of steps to move
00763                 if(argv->a_type == A_FLOAT){
00764                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_float;
00765                         argc--;
00766                         argv++;
00767                 }
00768                 else if(argv->a_type == A_LONG){
00769                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_long;
00770                         argc--;
00771                         argv++;
00772                 }
00773                 
00774                 // Look for args to specify a ramp time
00775                 if(argc){
00776                         if(argv->a_type == A_SYM){
00777                                 if(argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_ramp){
00778                                         argc--;
00779                                         argv++;
00780                                         if(argc){
00781                                                 ramptime = atom_getlong(argv);
00782                                                 if(ramptime){
00783                                                         atom_setsym(a+1, ps_ramp);
00784                                                         atom_setlong(a+2, ramptime);
00785                                                         a_len = 3;
00786                                                 }
00787                                         }
00788                                 }
00789                         }
00790                 }
00791         }
00792         
00793         if(x->ramper)
00794                 x->ramper->stop();
00795                 
00796         if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int)
00797                 atom_setlong(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_long + (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00798         else if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_float) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic))
00799                 atom_setfloat(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_float + (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00800         else if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_toggle){
00801                 if(x->attr_value.a_w.w_long == 1)
00802                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 0;
00803                 else
00804                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 1;
00805                 param_output_int(x);
00806                 return;
00807         }
00808         else{
00809                 error("%s parameter (in the %s module) is an inappropriate type for the 'inc' message.");
00810                 return;
00811         }
00812 
00813         param_dispatched(x, msg, a_len, a);
00814 }
00815 
00816 
00817 void param_dec(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00818 {
00819         float   stepmult = 1.0;
00820         long    ramptime = 0;           // ms
00821         t_atom  a[3];                           // value, 'ramp', value
00822         short   a_len = 1;
00823 
00824         // Check for slave mode
00825         if(x->attr_slavemode) {
00826                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], ps_dec, 0, NULL);
00827                 return;
00828         }
00829         
00830         // Check for Arguments...
00831         if(argc){
00832                 // Look for arg to specify the number of steps to move
00833                 if(argv->a_type == A_FLOAT){
00834                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_float;
00835                         argc--;
00836                         argv++;
00837                 }
00838                 else if(argv->a_type == A_LONG){
00839                         stepmult = argv->a_w.w_long;
00840                         argc--;
00841                         argv++;
00842                 }
00843                 
00844                 // Look for args to specify a ramp time
00845                 if(argc){
00846                         if(argv->a_type == A_SYM){
00847                                 if(argv->a_w.w_sym == ps_ramp){
00848                                         argc--;
00849                                         argv++;
00850                                         if(argc){
00851                                                 ramptime = atom_getlong(argv);
00852                                                 if(ramptime){
00853                                                         atom_setsym(a+1, ps_ramp);
00854                                                         atom_setlong(a+2, ramptime);
00855                                                         a_len = 3;
00856                                                 }
00857                                         }
00858                                 }
00859                         }
00860                 }
00861         }
00862 
00863         // new input - halt any ramping...
00864         if(x->ramper)
00865                 x->ramper->stop();
00866                 
00867         if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int)
00868                 atom_setlong(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_long - (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00869         else if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_float) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic))
00870                 atom_setfloat(a, x->attr_value.a_w.w_float - (x->attr_stepsize * stepmult));
00871         else if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_toggle){
00872                 if(x->attr_value.a_w.w_long == 1)
00873                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 0;
00874                 else
00875                         x->attr_value.a_w.w_long = 1;
00876                 param_output_int(x);
00877                 return;
00878         }
00879         else{
00880                 error("%s parameter (in the %s module) is an inappropriate type for the 'dec' message.");
00881                 return;
00882         }
00883 
00884         param_dispatched(x, msg, a_len, a);
00885 }
00886 
00887 
00888 // /ramp/update INPUT
00889 
00890 void param_rampUpdate(t_param *x)
00891 {
00892         //post("Requested to update.");
00893         
00894         x->ramper->tick();
00895 }
00896 
00897 
00898 // INT INPUT
00899 void param_int(t_param *x, long value)
00900 {
00901         // Check for slave mode
00902         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
00903                 outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], value);
00904                 return;
00905         }
00906         x->list_size = 1;
00907         if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
00908                 if(value == atom_getlong(&x->attr_value))
00909                         return;
00910         }
00911         // new input - halt any ramping...
00912         if(x->ramper)
00913                 x->ramper->stop();
00914         atom_setlong(&x->attr_value, value);
00915         x->param_output(x);
00916 }
00917 
00918 
00919 // FLOAT INPUT
00920 void param_float(t_param *x, double value)
00921 {
00922         // Check for slave mode
00923         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
00924                 outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], value);
00925                 return;
00926         }
00927         
00928         x->list_size = 1;
00929         if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
00930                 if(value == atom_getfloat(&x->attr_value))
00931                         return;
00932         }
00933         // new input - halt any ramping...
00934         if(x->ramper)
00935                 x->ramper->stop();
00936 
00937         atom_setfloat(&x->attr_value, value);
00938         x->param_output(x);
00939 }
00940 
00941 
00942 // SYMBOL INPUT
00943 void param_symbol(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00944 {
00945         // Check for slave mode
00946         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
00947                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], msg, argc, argv);
00948                 return;
00949         }
00950         
00951         x->list_size = 1;
00952         if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
00953                 if(jcom_core_atom_compare(x->common.attr_type, &x->attr_value, argv))
00954                         return;
00955         }
00956         atom_setsym(&x->attr_value, msg);
00957         x->param_output(x);
00958 
00959 }
00960 
00961 
00962 void param_ui_refresh(t_param *x)
00963 {
00964         if (!x->attr_slavemode)
00965                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_set], _sym_set, x->list_size, &x->attr_value);
00966 }
00967 
00968 
00969 // Send feedback to the hub
00970 void param_send_feedback(t_param *x)
00971 {
00972         t_atom output[LISTSIZE + 1];
00973         t_atom *out = (t_atom *)(&output);
00974         
00975         // send to our ui outlet
00976         if(x->attr_ui_freeze == 0)
00977                 qelem_set(x->ui_qelem);
00978         
00979         // call on the hub to pass our data onward
00980         if(x->common.hub != NULL){
00981                 jcom_core_atom_copy(out, &x->name_atom);
00982                 jcom_core_atom_copy(out+1, &x->attr_value);
00983                 // copy any remaining atoms
00984                 if(x->list_size > 1) 
00985                         sysmem_copyptr(&x->atom_list[1], out + 2, sizeof(t_atom) * (x->list_size - 1));
00986                 object_method_typed(x->common.hub, ps_feedback, x->list_size + 1, out, NULL);
00987         }
00988         // notify listeners (pattr or jcom.paramui) that we have modified data
00989 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
00990         object_notify(x, _sym_modified, NULL);
00991 #endif
00992 }
00993 
00994 
00995 // Send values to a potentially connected ui object at the first outlet
00996 void param_ui_queuefn(t_param *x)
00997 {
00998         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_set], _sym_set, x->list_size, &x->attr_value);
00999 }
01000 
01001 
01002 // messages received from jcom.hub
01003 void param_dispatched(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
01004 {
01005         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
01006                 if (argc==0)
01007                         outlet_bang(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct]);
01008                 else if (argc==1) {             
01009                         switch(argv[0].a_type) 
01010                                 {
01011                                         case A_LONG:
01012                                                 outlet_int(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], atom_getlong(argv));
01013                                                 break;
01014                                         case A_FLOAT:
01015                                                 outlet_float(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], atom_getfloat(argv));
01016                                                 break;
01017                                         case A_SYM:
01018                                                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], atom_getsym(argv), 0, 0L);
01019                                                 break;
01020                                         default:
01021                                                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], msg, argc, argv);
01022                                                 break;
01023                                 }
01024                 }
01025                 else
01026                         outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, argc, argv);
01027         }
01028         else {
01029                         // new input - halt any ramping...
01030                         if(x->ramper)
01031                                 x->ramper->stop();
01032                 
01033                         if(argc == 1 ){
01034                                 // If repetitions are disabled, we check for a repetition by treating
01035                                 // this as a 1 element list
01036                                 if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0 && param_list_compare(x->atom_list, 
01037                                         x->list_size, argv, argc)) 
01038                                         return;
01039 
01040                                 x->list_size = 1;                               
01041                                 jcom_core_atom_copy(&x->attr_value, argv);
01042                                 x->param_output(x);
01043                         } else if(argc > 1) {
01044                                 param_list(x, msg, argc, argv);
01045                         }
01046                         else {  // no args
01047 #ifndef JMOD_MESSAGE
01048                                 // generic parameters may have no arg -- i.e. to open a dialog that defines the arg
01049                                 if(x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic)
01050                                         x->list_size = 0;
01051 #endif                  
01052                                 x->param_output(x);
01053                         }
01054                 }
01055 }
01056 
01057 // Returns true if lists are identical
01058 int param_list_compare(t_atom *x, long lengthx, t_atom *y, long lengthy)
01059 {
01060         // If lists differ in length they're obviously not the same
01061         if(lengthx == lengthy) {
01062                 short type;
01063                 for(int i = 0; i < lengthx; i++) {
01064                         if((x->a_type) != (y->a_type))
01065                                 return 0; // not identical, types differ
01066                         
01067                         type = x->a_type;
01068                         if((type == A_FLOAT) && (x->a_w.w_float != y->a_w.w_float))
01069                                 return 0;
01070                         else if((type == A_LONG) && (x->a_w.w_long != y->a_w.w_long))
01071                                 return 0;
01072                         else if((type == A_SYM) && (x->a_w.w_sym != y->a_w.w_sym))
01073                                 return 0;
01074                         
01075                         x++; y++;  // keep going
01076                 }
01077         } 
01078         else {
01079                 return 0; // list lengths differ
01080         }
01081         
01082         return 1;
01083 }
01084 
01085 // LIST INPUT <value, ramptime>
01086 void param_list(t_param *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
01087 {
01088         double  start[LISTSIZE], values[LISTSIZE], time;
01089         int i;
01090         
01091         if (x->attr_slavemode) {
01092                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[k_outlet_direct], _sym_list, argc, argv);
01093                 return;
01094         }
01095                 
01096         // Check the second to last item in the list first, which when ramping should == the string ramp
01097         t_atom* ramp = argv + (argc - 2);
01098         if ( (ramp->a_type==A_SYM) && (ramp->a_w.w_sym==ps_ramp)) {
01099 
01100                 time = atom_getfloat(argv+(argc-1));
01101 
01102                 // Only one list member if @type is msg_int of msg_float
01103                 if ( x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int || x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_float)
01104                         argc = 1;
01105                 else
01106                         argc = argc - 2;
01107                 
01108                 for (i=0; i<argc; i++) {
01109                         values[i] = atom_getfloat(argv+i);
01110                         if (i<=x->list_size)
01111                                 start[i] = atom_getfloat(&x->atom_list[i]);
01112                         else
01113                                 start[i] = atom_getfloat(&x->atom_list[(x->list_size)-1]);
01114                 }
01115 
01116                 if(time <= 0){
01117                         jcom_core_atom_copy(&x->attr_value, argv);
01118                         x->param_output(x);
01119                         return;
01120                 }       
01121 
01122                 if(x->common.attr_repetitions == 0){
01123                         if(param_list_compare(x->atom_list, x->list_size, argv, argc))
01124                                 return; // nothing to do
01125                 }
01126 
01127                 x->list_size = argc;
01128                 x->ramper->set(argc, start);
01129                 x->ramper->go(argc, values, time);
01130         } 
01131         else {
01132                 // Don't output if the input data is identical
01133                 if(!x->common.attr_repetitions) {
01134                         if(param_list_compare(x->atom_list, x->list_size, argv, argc))
01135                                 return; // nothing to do
01136                 }
01137                 
01138                 // Avoid copying more than one atom if the type only can have one argument
01139                 if(x->common.attr_type != ps_msg_list && x->common.attr_type != ps_msg_generic
01140                         && x->common.attr_type != ps_msg_none) {
01141                         // If attr_type is != to anyone of the above values then we know 
01142                         // that it must be == to a scalar type.  This ensures it will behave
01143                         // as a scalar and not a list.
01144                         argc = 1;
01145                 }
01146                         
01147                 for(i = 0; i < argc; i++) {
01148                         switch(argv[i].a_type) 
01149                         {
01150                                 case A_LONG:
01151                                         atom_setlong(&x->atom_list[i], atom_getlong(argv + i));
01152                                         break;
01153                                 case A_FLOAT:
01154                                         atom_setfloat(&x->atom_list[i], atom_getfloat(argv + i));
01155                                         break;
01156                                 case A_SYM:
01157                                         atom_setsym(&x->atom_list[i], atom_getsym(argv + i));
01158                                         break;
01159                                 default:
01160                                         error("param_list: no type specification");
01161                                         break;
01162                         }
01163                 }
01164                 x->list_size = argc;
01165                 x->param_output(x);
01166         }
01167 }
01168 
01169 
01170 #pragma mark -
01171 #pragma mark Ramp Units
01172 
01173 void param_ramp_callback_float(void *v, short, double *value)
01174 {
01175         t_param *x = (t_param *)v;
01176         float   oldval = atom_getfloat(&x->attr_value);
01177         
01178         if(x->common.attr_repetitions || *value != oldval){
01179                 atom_setfloat(&x->attr_value, *value);
01180                 param_output_float(x);
01181         }
01182 }
01183 
01184 
01185 void param_ramp_callback_int(void *v, short, double *value)
01186 {
01187         t_param *x= (t_param *)v;
01188         long    val     = *value;
01189         long    oldval;
01190 
01191         oldval = atom_getlong(&x->attr_value);
01192         if (x->common.attr_repetitions || val != oldval){
01193                 atom_setlong(&x->attr_value, val);
01194                 param_output_int(x);
01195         }
01196 }
01197 
01198 
01199 void param_ramp_callback_list(void *v, short argc, double *value)
01200 {
01201         long i;
01202         t_param *x = (t_param *)v;
01203         
01204         // we won't bother about avoiding repetitions for list, so never mind oldval
01205 
01206         for (i=0; i<argc; i++)
01207                 atom_setfloat(&x->atom_list[i], value[i]);
01208         param_output_list(x);   
01209 }
01210 
01211 
01212 void param_ramp_setup(t_param *x)
01213 {
01214         // 1. destroy the old rampunit
01215         if(x->ramper != NULL)
01216                 delete x->ramper;
01217                 
01218         // 2. create the new rampunit
01219         // For some types ramping doesn't make sense, so they will be set to none
01220         if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_none) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_symbol) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_generic))
01221                 x->attr_ramp = gensym("none");
01222                 
01223         if((x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_int) || (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_toggle))
01224                 x->ramper = new rampunit(x->attr_ramp->s_name, param_ramp_callback_int, (void *)x);
01225         else if (x->common.attr_type == ps_msg_list)
01226                 x->ramper = new rampunit(x->attr_ramp->s_name, param_ramp_callback_list, (void *)x);
01227         else
01228                 x->ramper = new rampunit(x->attr_ramp->s_name, param_ramp_callback_float, (void *)x);
01229 
01230         if(x->ramper == NULL)
01231                 error("jcom.parameter (%s module): could not allocate memory for ramp unit!", x->common.module_name);
01232                 
01233         if(x->attr_rampfunction && x->attr_rampfunction != _sym_nothing && x->attr_rampfunction != gensym("linear"))
01234                 object_attr_setsym(x, gensym("ramp/function"), x->attr_rampfunction);
01235 }
